intro: Sannantha whitei, commonly known as the white sannantha, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer seasons. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a slightly hairy texture. Sannantha whitei is often found in sandy or rocky soils in open woodlands and heathlands.
